label: SILENCE
description: Let silence become a presence that presses on the room.

label: NOISE
description: Make noise feel textured, like grain in wood or grit in teeth.

label: RHYTHM
description: Use rhythm to suggest intelligence without showing a face.

label: HARMONY
description: Let harmony misbehave, resolving only when something is understood.

label: SPATIALITY
description: Make space audible, so distance becomes a sound.

label: MOTIFS
description: Treat sonic motifs like recurring dreams, familiar and altered.

label: WEIGHT
description: Let motion carry weight through anticipation, not speed.

label: STILLNESS
description: Make stillness feel active, as if something is deciding.

label: CHOREOGRAPHY
description: Turn swarms into choreography that implies intention without speech.

label: MOTION
description: Let movement reveal rules, the way dance reveals muscle and constraint.

label: TIMBRE
description: Choose a soundâ€™s material quality so the world feels made of wood, metal, glass, or breath.

label: DYNAMICS
description: Let loudness behave like emotion, swelling and shrinking as attention shifts.

label: ATTACK
description: Shape how sounds begin so impacts feel sharp, soft, or reluctant.

label: DECAY
description: Let notes fade in a way that reveals the room, the medium, and the mood.

label: SUSTAIN
description: Hold tones long enough that they become atmosphere rather than event.

label: RELEASE
description: End sounds like endings, clean cuts or slow dissolves that change the aftertaste.

label: REVERB
description: Use echoes to make emptiness feel huge or intimacy feel tight.

label: ECHO
description: Let repeating reflections turn single actions into patterns with intent.

label: DELAY
description: Stagger repeats so time itself feels elastic and slightly haunted.

label: DISTORTION
description: Roughen audio until it feels like the signal is fighting its way through reality.

label: SATURATION
description: Warm the edges of sound so it feels close, alive, and imperfectly human.

label: CLIPPING
description: Let overload be audible so intensity becomes physically uncomfortable on purpose.

label: FREQUENCY
description: Aim high and low bands to tickle nerves, not just ears.

label: SUBBASS
description: Make low vibration a bodily event, the floor participating in the score.

label: HISS
description: Use noise floor like atmosphere, a faint fog that makes silence meaningful.

label: CLICK
description: Let tiny percussive details read as machinery, insects, or impatient thought.

label: PULSE
description: Anchor the soundscape to a heartbeat that can quicken, falter, or stop.

label: METER
description: Lock time into a grid, then break the grid to signal rebellion or panic.

label: SWING
description: Make timing lean forward and back so groove feels like personality.

label: SYNCOPATION
description: Place accents where comfort expects none, so the body stays alert.

label: POLYRHYTHM
description: Stack competing cycles until the listener feels a living, multi-brained system.

label: OSTINATO
description: Repeat a figure until it becomes a spell, then change one note to break it.

label: DRONE
description: Hold a steady tone like a horizon so small events feel monumental.

label: MELODY
description: Give the ear a path to follow, then let it get lost and find itself again.

label: COUNTERMELODY
description: Let a second line comment on the first, like subtext you can hum.

label: DISSONANCE
description: Make intervals scrape so tension becomes audible friction.

label: CONSONANCE
description: Offer harmonic rest like shelter, then decide how safe that shelter truly is.

label: RESOLUTION
description: Delay the satisfying chord until understanding arrives with it.

label: MODULATION
description: Change key like changing weather, so the same theme feels newly moral.

label: MICROTONES
description: Use in-between pitches to make reality feel slightly off its rails.

label: GLISSANDO
description: Slide between notes so motion is audible, not just implied.

label: ARPEGGIO
description: Turn chords into cascades so harmony becomes movement.

label: STACCATO
description: Make sound arrive in bites, nervous, playful, or tactical.

label: LEGATO
description: Connect tones so the score feels like breath and continuous thought.

label: TREMOLO
description: Shake a note so the listener feels instability inside apparent stillness.

label: VIBRATO
description: Waver pitch gently so emotion sounds human, not geometric.

label: PERCUSSION
description: Let impacts define space, turning surfaces into instruments.

label: FOLEY
description: Make everyday sounds narrate action more honestly than music does.

label: DIEGETIC
description: Keep sound inside the world so it feels grounded, accountable, and real.

label: NONdiegetic
description: Let music speak from outside the world, commenting like an unseen narrator.

label: LAYERING
description: Stack textures until the soundscape feels like ecology rather than track.

label: MASKING
description: Hide crucial sounds behind others so discovery feels like learning to listen.

label: ISOLATION
description: Strip the mix down to one voice so attention becomes a spotlight.

label: PAN
description: Move sound left and right so motion is felt in the skull.

label: DEPTH
description: Place sources near and far using loudness and reverb, making distance tangible.

label: HEIGHT
description: Use spectral cues to suggest above and below, so the world gains vertical audio.

label: SURROUND
description: Wrap sound around the listener so orientation becomes a sense, not a guess.

label: DOPPLER
description: Shift pitch with motion so speed becomes audible truth.

label: RUMBLE
description: Let distant low thunder imply scale and approaching consequence.

label: WHISPER
description: Make quiet speech intimate and threatening by forcing the listener closer.

label: CHANT
description: Use repeated voices to manufacture ritual, unity, and trance.

label: CALL
description: Let one signal invite response, turning the environment into conversation.

label: RESPONSE
description: Answer motifs with altered echoes so the system sounds like it is thinking.

label: SIREN
description: Use alarm tones sparingly so urgency stays sharp and credible.

label: ALARM
description: Make danger audible before visible, forcing anticipation to do the work.

label: LULLABY
description: Use soothing patterns to create safety, then let the safety turn ironic.

label: DIRGE
description: Slow the music into gravity, making loss feel unavoidable and ceremonial.

label: FANFARE
description: Announce achievement with bright brass energy, then question what was won.

label: GROOVE
description: Make repetition pleasurable so the body stays engaged without explanation.

label: TEMPTATION
description: Design a sonic lure that pulls the listener toward risk.

label: UNEASE
description: Use subtle dissonance and off-timing so comfort never fully arrives.

label: SHIMMER
description: Add high, delicate textures so lightness feels airborne.

label: GRIT
description: Use rough textures to imply labor, damage, or truth without polish.

label: SPARK
description: Introduce quick bright transients so moments feel like sudden ideas.

label: SWELL
description: Build crescendos slowly so emotion arrives as inevitability.

label: DROP
description: Remove layers abruptly so absence hits like a physical step down.

label: PAUSE
description: Use silence between notes as punctuation that changes meaning.

label: BREATH
description: Let inhalations and exhalations be audible, turning bodies into instruments.

label: FOOTSTEPS
description: Make movement legible through contact sounds, revealing material and intent.

label: RUSTLE
description: Use soft friction noises to imply nearby life even when unseen.

label: SPLASH
description: Let water impacts encode force, scale, and panic instantly.

label: CRACK
description: Use sharp breaks to signal brittle materials, sudden failure, or cold air.

label: HUM
description: Keep a constant low tone so machinery or magic feels always-on.

label: BUZZ
description: Add nervous high vibration so the environment feels electrically alive.

label: CHIME
description: Use bell-like tones to mark transitions like tiny rituals.

label: BELLS
description: Let resonant strikes suggest place, ceremony, and time passing.

label: STRIDE
description: Give gait a signature rhythm so characters are identifiable by motion alone.

label: GLIDE
description: Make movement smooth and low-friction so the world feels dreamlike or advanced.

label: JERK
description: Use abrupt starts and stops so motion reads as fear, hostility, or malfunction.

label: DRIFT
description: Let bodies wander with soft randomness so intention feels ambiguous.

label: SWARM
description: Make many small motions cohere into one large behavior, like a living cloud.

label: FLOCK
description: Let agents align and turn together, making group intelligence visible and beautiful.

label: VORTEX
description: Spiral motion inward to suggest attraction, doom, or focus.

label: ORBIT
description: Make entities circle a center so relationships become geometry.

label: COLLISION
description: Let impacts be consequential, changing direction, mood, and structure.

label: RECOIL
description: Make reaction motion visible, so forces feel reciprocal and real.

label: INERTIA
description: Let mass resist change, making acceleration feel costly.

label: FRICTION
description: Make motion scrape and slow so surfaces and effort become part of the story.

label: MOMENTUM
description: Let sustained movement carry characters past their own intentions.

label: BALANCE
description: Show tiny corrections in posture so stability feels continuously negotiated.
